_exec_summary.SummaryText: This facility complies with requirements for Anhydrous Ammonia storage. Farmers Cooperative Company owns this fertilizer facility, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws. We sell anhydrous ammonia to farmers for fertilizer use only. The storage tank constists of 30,000 gallons of anhydrous ammonia and associated piping, valves, and other miscellaneous equipment.  Our worst-case scenario is failure of the 30,000 gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest allowed. According to EPA,s look-up tables, the distance to the endpoint is 4.4 miles. Ther are schools, residences, public recreational areas, ans businesses within the distance to the endpoint, with a total population of 1252. This facility complies with EPA,s accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with OSHA (29CFR 1910.111) We have never had an accident involving ammonia that caused death, injuries, property or environmental damage, or evacuations.  In the event of an emergency involving our ammonia tank, it is our policy to notify the Readlyn Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. They wound intern call the Hazmat Team in Waterloo. Members of the fire department have inspected our ammonia tank. The Iowa Department of Agriculture and Land Stewardship perform regular yearly inspections of this facility. An employeethat is trained on Ammonia Safety performs daily inspections. Safety relief valves, fittings, and hoses are replaced in accordance with the law. Maintenance records are kept on all anhydrous ammonia equipment.
